abstract: Since its debut earlier this month "Homeland," with Claire Danes, Damian Lewis and Mandy Patinkin, has been Showtime's highest-rated first-year drama series.
snippet: Since its debut earlier this month "Homeland," with Claire Danes, Damian Lewis and Mandy Patinkin, has been Showtime's highest-rated first-year drama series.
lead_paragraph: Orange alert! The Department of Homeland Security may have retired its color-coded terrorism alert system, but the pervading sense of paranoia that it represented isn't going away, and neither is Showtime's hit series, "Homeland." On Wednesday that cable channel said it had ordered a second season of "Homeland," its serialized thriller about a dogged if possibly paranoid C.I.A. officer (played by Claire Danes), a recently released American prisoner of war (Damian Lewis) who may be a sleeper agent for Al Qaeda, and Mandy Patinkin's epic beard. (O.K., the beard is not as crucial to the story, but some of us still find it fascinating.)

headline.main: Showtime Thriller 'Homeland' Secures a Second Season
